briefTitle: Safety of a Quadrivalent Meningococcal Conjugate Vaccine Administered Concomitantly With Routine Pediatric Vaccines in Healthy Infants and Toddlers
officialTitle: A Randomized Study to Describe the Safety of an Investigational Quadrivalent Meningococcal Conjugate Vaccine Administered Concomitantly With Routine Pediatric Vaccines in Healthy Infants and Toddlers

interventions.name: Meningococcal polysaccharide (serogroups A,C,Y and W) tetanus toxoid Conjugate vaccine (MenACYW Conjugate vaccine)
Meningococcal (Groups A, C, Y and W 135) Oligosaccharide Diphtheria CRM197 Conjugate Vaccine (MENVEO速)
Diphtheria, Tetanus, Acellular Pertussis, Poliovirus and Haemophilus b Vaccine
Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Virus Vaccine

summary: The primary objective of this study was to describe the safety profile of Meningococcal Polysaccharide (Serogroups A, C, Y, and W) Tetanus Toxoid (MenACYW) Conjugate Vaccine and Meningococcal (Groups A, C, Y and W 135) Oligosaccharide Diphtheria CRM197 (MENVEO速) Conjugate Vaccine when administered concomitantly with routine pediatric vaccines in healthy infants and toddlers.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Immediate Unsolicited Systemic Adverse Events (AEs)
